reviews.review_msg: A lot of students judge Dr. Pio very unfairly. If you take the time to sit at the front of the class and talk to him outside of lectures you will see that he is a very knowledgable and helpful teacher. I had no problem understanding his French accent (I'm not French).

He might not be a very good prof,but this course can still earn you very good grades,he's really nice and tries to help as much as he is capable of,the contents are actually quite helpful for research careers
a very nice prof, willing to help. But his lectures were extremely boring and dry. It was not easy to understand him due to his heavy accent.

Extremely thick French accent --- takes a while to get used to but you understand it over time. Clearly knows the material well but not so good at communicating it. Lectures and midterms were textbook-based. Easy presentation marker.
If you are fluent in French, then he is the prof for you ; otherwise ... hire a translator!
